text: date: mon, 27 dec 1999 15:44:42 -0500 from: jack steele (jesteele@prodigy.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: leap yearleap year glitch indeed ("programmers took leap of faith," 27.dec.99). i really didn't expect programers to be that stupid. years divisible by four are leap years. 2000 is thus a leap year. it is not the first of a century but the last year of the twentieth century. apparently people are too influenced by odometers which indicate miles past, not the mile currently being run. the calendar indicates the year in progress, not the year completed. the year 2000 is the last of the century. without it the century would have only 99 years, hardly a century (100).
